result.execSummary:
The defendant David M. Conrow #00559316 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender - Use Different Name, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.47(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
1) The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice. 
2) The Clerk of Courts may enter a prison wage assignment to collect payment from the any DOC account the defendant has.
Defendant shall not use or possess firearms for life.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David M. Conrow #00559316

records.addlTxt:
10:25 AM Defendant David M. Conrow #00559316 appeared by video, in custody. Atty Gabriel Pollak appears in person on behalf of the defense.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def waives all in person hearing KIV.  Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Pollak: def pleading to Ct 1- sex offender, use different name (FH), remaining count DRI, joint rec for court costs only sentence.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea. Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 and orders a JOC; Count 2 is DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def makes a statement to the Court.  
Court orders: 
$518 court costs.  Defendant shall not use or possess firearms for life. Defendant shall not vote in any election until their civil rights are restored. Court may enter a prison wage assignment.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff.

Defense attorney updates the Court: def in Stanley Correctional on revoked case; parties negotiating, likely to resolve, requests additional status.  Current tentative offer recited by Atty Pollak- plead to 1 count for court costs.  Def in custody until August 2024.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Plea/sentencing hearing on August 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.

03:26 PM Defendant David M. Conrow in court with attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Defendant in custody.  Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for State of Wisconsin.  David M. Conrow appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Status conference scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:40 AM Defendant David M. Conrow in court with attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Defendant in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Def appears in person.  Case is on for preliminary hearing.  State calls first witness, Detective Patrick Carlson, who is sworn in and testifies.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Venue is made.  Atty Pollak crosses.  Atty Rennicke redirects.  State rests and asks for a bindover.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  The matter is bound over for further proceedings.  The State files information.  Arraignment scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 6, 2022 at 11:30 am.

ADA Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Contact information updated.  Jail needs fingerprints.  Attny Pollak requests PH within time limits please, def on probation hold.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 11:30 am.
